oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.visualInformationBuilder.businessRules.publicCommon.core.rules
Interface RuleCondition

All Superinterfaces:
ModelComponent, java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ObrRuleConditionImpl, RuleConditionEx
public interface RuleCondition
extends ModelComponent

RuleCondition is used for creating simple and nested conditions in the rules. For simple conditions only operand, operator and value have to be specified. Parenthesis and NOT operator are represented through specifying nested RuleCondition members. Connective is used for specifying logical connection with next condition (and, or). Example of a complex condition: not (A && (B || C)) It will require following structure: RuleCondition nestedOperator: NestedOperator.NOT RuleCondition test: A connective: Connective.AND RuleCondition nestedOperator: NestedOperator.PARENTHESIS RuleCondition test: B connective: Connective.OR RuleCondition test: C

Nested Class Summary
static class RuleCondition.AggregationOperator
          Aggregate operator.
static class RuleCondition.Connective
          Connective to specify logical AND, OR operators.
static class RuleCondition.NestedOperator
          Nested operator to construct parenthesis and NOT operator.
